content.question: Which of the following best justifies the use of the study area to investigate how one species influences the behavior of another?

choices.label: Black stingrays were present in the study area in the presence and absence of blacktip reef sharks.
Giant shovelnose rays and cowtail rays spent long periods of time at rest while inside the study area.
Natural barriers in the study area prevented lemon sharks from competing with blacktip reef sharks for limited resources.
Cowtail rays in the study area formed groups at some stages of the tide cycle but remained alone at other stages.

content.answer: Black stingrays were present in the study area in the presence and absence of blacktip reef sharks.

skill.text: 6.C: Provide reasoning to justify a claim by connecting evidence to biological theories.
